action.action-desc: Ms. DeLauro (for herself, Ms. Slaughter, Mr. Rangel, and Ms. Speier) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture

form.official-title: To amend the Federal Meat Inspection Act, the Poultry Products Inspection Act, and the Egg Products Inspection Act to provide that meat, poultry, and egg products containing certain pathogens or contaminants are adulterated, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Pathogen Reduction and Testing Reform Act of 2015.

section.header: Products containing certain pathogens or contaminants adulterated

subsection.text: Section 1(m) of the Federal Meat Inspection Act (21 U.S.C. 601(m)) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by inserting or a microbial pathogen that is associated with serious illness or death after which may render it injurious to health; and
by inserting or such a microbial pathogen after added substance; and
by redesignating subparagraphs (B), (C), and (D) as subparagraphs (C), (D), and (E), respectively;
by inserting after subparagraph (A) the following new subparagraph:

if it bears or contains a strain of a microbial pathogen, such as Campylobacter or Salmonella, that is resistant to not fewer than two critically important antibiotics for human medicine (as specified in the World Health Organization’s list of Critically Important Antimicrobials);
in subparagraph (E) (as redesignated by subparagraph (A)) by striking clause (B), (C), or (D) and inserting this subparagraph or subparagraph (C) or (D).

subsection.text: Section 4(g) of the Poultry Products Inspection Act (21 U.S.C. 453(g)) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by inserting or a microbial pathogen that is associated with serious illness or death after which may render it injurious to health; and
by inserting or such a microbial pathogen after added substance; and
by redesignating subparagraphs (B), (C), and (D) as subparagraphs (C), (D), and (E), respectively;
by inserting after subparagraph (A) the following new subparagraph:

if it bears or contains a strain of a microbial pathogen, such as Campylobacter or Salmonella, that is resistant to not fewer than two critically important antibiotics for human medicine (as specified in the World Health Organization’s list of Critically Important Antimicrobials);
in subparagraph (E) (as redesignated by subparagraph (A)) by striking clause (B), (C), or (D) and inserting this subparagraph or subparagraph (C) or (D).

subsection.text: Section 4(a) of the Egg Products Inspection Act (21 U.S.C. 1033(a)) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by inserting or a microbial pathogen that is associated with serious illness or death after which may render it injurious to health; and
by inserting or such a microbial pathogen after added substance; and
by redesignating subparagraphs (B), (C), and (D) as subparagraphs (C), (D), and (E), respectively;
by inserting after subparagraph (A) the following new subparagraph:

if it bears or contains a strain of a microbial pathogen, such as Campylobacter or Salmonella, that is resistant to not fewer than two critically important antibiotics for human medicine (as specified in the World Health Organization’s list of Critically Important Antimicrobials);
in subparagraph (E) (as redesignated by subparagraph (A)) by striking clause (B), (C), or (D) and inserting this subparagraph or subparagraph (C) or (D).

section.header: Testing for certain pathogens or contaminants required

subsection.text: The Federal Meat Inspection Act is amended by inserting after section 9 (21 U.S.C. 609) the following new section:

section.header: Testing for certain pathogens or contaminants required
section.text: Not later than one year after the date of the enactment of this section, the Secretary shall, for purposes of examinations or inspections conducted under this Act, establish sampling protocols and testing procedures using the methods and technologies the Secretary determines are most appropriate—

paragraph.text: to determine if meat and meat food products are adulterated within the meaning of paragraph (1) or (2)(B) of section 1(m); and
to prevent the use in commerce of any product that is determined to be so adulterated.

subsection.text: The Poultry Products Inspection Act is amended by inserting after section 8 (21 U.S.C. 457) the following new section:

section.header: Testing for certain pathogens or contaminants required
section.text: Not later than one year after the date of the enactment of this section, the Secretary shall, for purposes of examinations or inspections conducted under this Act, establish sampling protocols and testing procedures using the methods and technologies the Secretary determines are most appropriate—

paragraph.text: to determine if poultry and poultry products are adulterated within the meaning of paragraph (1) or (2)(B) of section 4(g); and
to prevent the entry into or flow or movement in commerce of, or the burdening of commerce by, any such product that is determined to be so adulterated.

subsection.text: The Egg Products Inspection Act is amended by inserting after section 7 (21 U.S.C. 1036) the following new section:

section.header: Testing for certain pathogens or contaminants required
section.text: Not later than one year after the date of the enactment of this section, the Secretary shall, for purposes of examinations or inspections conducted under this Act, establish sampling protocols and testing procedures using the methods and technologies the Secretary determines are most appropriate—

paragraph.text: to determine if eggs and egg products are adulterated within the meaning of paragraph (1) or (2)(B) of section 4(a); and
to prevent the entry into or flow or movement in commerce of, or the burdening of commerce by, any such product that is determined to be so adulterated.

subsection.text: Not later than 18 months after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Agriculture shall issue regulations to carry out the amendments made by this Act.

The amendments made by this Act shall apply with respect to meat and meat food products, poultry and poultry products, and eggs and egg products entering into interstate or foreign commerce on or after the date of the enactment of this Act.
